title: WCAS HISTORY 405-0-21 Seminar in Historical Analysis

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This is a graduate reading seminar on the intersection of race and gender in the United States. We will examine theoretical, historical, sociological, anthropological, and literary works by and about women of color, immigrants, and LGBT-identified people. The course is designed for graduate students in the humanities, social sciences and communications with research or teaching interests in race, gender, immigration or diaspora studies, or ethnic studies.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Attendance and discussion (20%), Presentations and leading short discussions (20%), Weekly Response Papers (30%), Term Project(30%)

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: Readings will include works by Chela Sandoval, Cherrie Moraga, Evelyn Nakano Glenn, Catherine Ceniza Choy, Chandra Mohanty.

subject: HISTORY
